posts.author: Bloodedblade
posts.content: Just started playing again after a long time away and found out how much I missed this game. I've started on Amia and it seems its a fairly magical world but with a top level restriction of 30. I tend to play my clerics like fighters more then healbots which I find boring. I have read a few builds in here but just can't get into the whole monk/cleric I prefer to play more fighter/cleric with a hammer or even a bastard sword something with a shield for the ac. I know its not the optimal build it would seem but its what I like. I have been leaning towards Tempus for the Deity so at least the strength domain for the divine powers the other domain I'm flexible on. I would appreciate any help from those willing as I find myself rather rusty on game mechanics as it is.

Take Strength Domain for Divine Power on 2 levels, and either Trickery or Travel depending whether Haste or Imp Invis is easier to come by.

Any of the non-essential feats (luck of heros, toughness, etc) could be swapped for craft wand if that's more helpful (or scribe scroll if you find yourself running out of Divine Favor/Ext DF) or if you want Weapon Prof: Exotic for Bastard Sword.

Kept 3 FTR levels pre-epic to take advantage of Divine Power and for extra bonus feat in epic while still keeping undispellability for 24 Cleric levels.

There might be a more efficient stat distribution, not quite sure, but if you gimp INT lower than 13, you'll lose expertise and Imp knockdown.

You'll easily be able to reach the AB cap with just self buffing spells (+5 DP, +5 DF, +1 bless, +1 AID, +2 battletide, +1 Prayer, +5 GMW), so you'll prob be able to afford 5 AB if you just want to permanently go around in expertise mode for some extra defense.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Chaozrulez wrote:Put the 4th Fighter level pre-epic so you can get 4 attacks!
We are leaving it at 3 attacks on purpose. With the Divine Power spell, you will gain that 4th attack at the highest AB, but only if you don't already have a 4th attack. That's a difference of 15 AB on that 4th attack.

posts.author: Dante2377
posts.content:
Yes, that definitely changes it - pull the 4th level of fighter into pre-epic. Doesn't matter where as long as you take Weapon Spec with it.

Empyre's suggestions for Cleave (replaces the saving throw feats in my build) on lvl 1 is a good one if it's slow leveling - that extra attack early on after killing a monster is really effective early game.

Unless a lot of early mobs have HIS or use darkness/blind, I'd take Knockdown before Blind Fight every time. I'd also take improved crit before toughness as well - the extra crit on a warhammer is worth a lot more to me at lvl 11 than 11 HP.

I also generally find that other feats like expertise, improved crit, etc are more effective earlier than Extend Spell (bc it's really only extending your rd/lvl buff a few rounds) and that Cleric level 9 really starts to make Extend Spell effective enough to be worth the feat.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: Also, an NPC will identify as the class you had at level 1, so they would call you a Fighter, even though you have 4 times as many Cleric levels.

posts.author: Dante2377
posts.content: On a PW like Amia though rather than the OC or other module, that's probably not an issue. Almost every PW that I know of that looks for class looks for the highest level amongst your classes, not what you took first.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
At first pass, i think the wisest thing you can do is put a single lvl of Monk at 27th level at the cost of 1 Cleric and not Fighter lvl. You retain all bonus feats from both Cleric & Fighter and you loose only 1 caster lvl.

Keep in mind that this will make you dispellable by Greater dispel magic but meh, it is only a 5% chance and anyway is way better than losing EWS or something else.

This will work better in the first build since it will add also Cleave to your repertoire apart from +3 AC & evasion.


Also, do not worry about "losing" the Monk WIS bonus to your AC since the maximum you can get from that with this amount is only 10 Ac (WIS 31).

You better keep your full plate & Tower Shield and cast magic vestment on both for a total of 21 AC (+5 full plate & +5 tower shield).
